title: Stanley Cup playoffs mega-preview: Championship cases, X factors, bold predictions for all 16 teams
content: The postseason Thunderdome is about to open its gate. Which team will emerge as the 2025 Stanley Cup champion?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the 2025 playoffs: The NHL's second season begins
content: Miss anything the past six months? Miss EVERYTHING? Here are the top teams, players, matchups and more.

title: Ejected Chisholm rips ump on X, then deletes post
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr. was ejected from the Yankees' 6-3 victory over the Rays then appeared to violate MLB's social media policy when he posted in-game criticism online.

title: Coach Prime responds to jersey retirement critics
content: Deion Sanders responded to criticism from former Colorado players Thursday who claim the retirement of jersey numbers for Travis Hunter and Shedeur Sanders is too soon.

title: NHL sets attendance record, surpassing 23M fans
content: The NHL reported an attendance figure of 23,014,458 across the 1,312-game regular season, setting a league record for the third consecutive season.

title: Stricken by bite, Texas' Corbin nearly missed start
content: Rangers lefty Patrick Corbin said an apparent venomous bite on his foot made it difficult for him to walk and nearly forced him to miss Wednesday's start against the Angels.

title: Rodgers still unsure on future, rips Jets for exit
content: Future Hall of Fame quarterback Aaron Rodgers said Thursday on "The Pat McAfee Show" that he is not ready to make a decision on his plans for the 2025 season and allowed that retirement could still be a possibility.

title: Ex-South Alabama QB Lopez commits to UNC
content: Former South Alabama quarterback Gio Lopez, one of the top passers in the spring transfer portal, has committed to North Carolina, he announced on social media Thursday.

title: Ovi closes historic season with 897th career goal
content: Alex Ovechkin scored his 44th goal of the season to move his all-time record total to 897 on Thursday in the Capitals' 5-2 loss to the Penguins in the regular-season finale.

title: Saints' Ramczyk, 30, retires: 'Incredible journey'
content: Saints right tackle Ryan Ramczyk anounced his retirement from the NFL on Thursday after seven seasons.

title: Bill Belichick's new book underscores the importance of personal connections
content: Bill Belichick's new book "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football" highlights the role relationships play in the sport.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to WrestleMania 41: John Cena thinks you're awful
content: As a service to fans who have a general interest in WWE, we're happy to provide this WrestleMania 41 FAQ.

title: ‘I’ll beat you tomorrow for $10k’: Inside the secret world of MLB pickleball
content: Here's how the pickleball court is replacing the golf course as where the baseball world gets away from the game.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Man United breathe life into an otherwise dismal season with a legendary comeback
content: Man United almost lost to 10-man Lyon before waging a thrilling comeback. The flaws make United's Europa League run what it is.

title: Amorim watched '99 doc before wild Utd comeback
content: Ruben Amorim said he watched Manchester United's 1999 documentary for "inspiration" before his team fought back to record a stunning victory over Lyon.

title: Ange: 'You'll have to put up with me a bit longer'
content: Ange Postecoglou told his critics they will "have to put up with me for just a little bit longer" after Tottenham Hotspur sealed a UEFA Europa League semifinal spot with a 1-0 win against Eintracht Frankfurt in Germany.

title: LaLiga seals 5 spots in '25'-'26 Champions League
content: LaLiga will join the Premier League in having five teams in the Champions League next season after it secured the second of the extra places.

title: Messi: New foreign players making MLS 'stronger'
content: Inter Miami CF star Lionel Messi said he's seen the level of Major League Soccer continue to rise as clubs sign young, foreign players, and said this season has been his most competitive yet since arriving to the South Florida team in the summer of 2023.

title: Marsch banned 2 games after red card vs. USMNT
content: Canada coach Jesse Marsch has been suspended for an extra game by Concacaf following his actions during the team's Nations League third-place playoff against the USMNT last month.

title: Report: Security failures led to Copa final chaos
content: Officials for Miami-Dade County said a lack of intelligence gathering, insufficient security perimeters and large numbers of unticketed fans led to the chaotic scene that unfolded ahead of last year's Copa América final.

title: Neymar exits in tears after fresh injury setback
content: Neymar suffered a fresh injury setback when the Brazil star was forced to leave Santos' match with Atlético-MG due to a left thigh injury.

title: Van Dijk signs contract extension at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has signed a contract extension, putting an end to speculation over whether this season would be his last at Anfield.

title: Winners and losers: Picks we loved -- and picks that left us scratching our heads
content: Will Sedona Prince play in the WNBA? Is Dominique Malonga a future MVP? We revisit all the WNBA draft picks.

title: What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: A roller coaster of a day: The highs and lows of NCAA gymnastics semifinals
content: The NCAA gymnastics semifinals were as wild as predicted, with major upsets to both No. 1 LSU and No. 3 Florida.

title: How Northwestern QB Jack Lausch is adjusting to the diamond
content: While Lausch is reacclimating to baseball, he's still competing for snaps in spring practices. How long can he keep it up?

title: Transfer tracker: Latest entrants and commitments
content: The transfer cycle is in full swing. We're tracking the latest players to enter the portal and commit.

title: This weekend's spring game previews: Colorado, Michigan, Texas A&M and more
content: The Buffs take the field without their biggest stars, Michigan has a new QB, and more spring storylines.

title: Champions League semifinal predictions: Arsenal or PSG? Barcelona or Inter Milan?
content: We're down to the final four in Europe's top club competition, so who do we think has the power, talent and grit to reach the final? Our writers make their picks.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: How Liverpool sealed Salah, Van Dijk contracts amid struggle to keep Alexander-Arnold
content: Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have committed their futures to Liverpool, but how did the club convince them to stay? And will that persuade Trent Alexander-Arnold to snub Real Madrid?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern have advantage to sign Wirtz
content: Bayern believe they are in pole position to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: MLS, Saudi Arabia or another club in Europe: What's next for Kevin de Bruyne?
content: Premier League superstar Kevin De Bruyne will be a free agent soon as Man City opted not to renew him. So, with MLS and Saudi interest, what will he do next?

title: Carroll hits 35 homers? Soderstrom hits 50? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: 'Intrusion on legislature's supremacy': Kapil Sibal slams Dhankhar's SC remarks
content: Kapil Sibal criticized Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's disapproval of the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential bill decisions and Tamil Nadu governor's bill withholding. Sibal emphasized that both the President and governors must act on ministerial advice, accusing the governor of interfering with legislative authority.

title: Trump admin has revoked over 1,000 student visas without warning since March
content: Over 1,000 international students, including those at Harvard and Stanford, have had their US visas revoked, causing widespread confusion and legal challenges. Universities discovered the terminations through a Homeland Security database, often without prior notice or explanation. Lawsuits allege unlawful revocations and lack of due process.

title: BJP claims police debunked Mamata's blame on 'outsiders' for Bengal violence
content: BJP leader Amit Malviya has challenged Mamata Banerjee's claims regarding the Murshidabad communal violence, citing police reports that contradict her narrative of "outsiders" being responsible. Malviya alleges that the violence, which resulted in three deaths and numerous arrests, was instigated by local youths, as indicated by intelligence inputs and police findings.

title: Aman Gupta on Blu Smart fraud: Bachpan mein jo parents ne ...
content: Shark Tank India judge Aman Gupta addressed the BluSmart fraud scandal, emphasizing ethics and governance. Gupta highlighted the damage to investor and customer trust due to alleged financial mismanagement involving fund diversion for luxury purchases.

title: 'Personal fallouts being given criminal colour': HC grants bail to rape accused
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to Arun Kumar Mishra, accused of rape, raising concerns about failed relationships leading to criminal charges. Justice Krishan Pahal noted the consensual nature of the relationship and the delayed FIR filing. The court highlighted a societal trend of transient relationships and cautioned against misusing penal laws amid emotional fallout.

title: DGCA orders probe into Air India Express captain Armaan's death
content: Following the tragic death of Air India Express First Officer Armaan after a Srinagar-Delhi flight, the DGCA has launched a thorough investigation. The probe will examine his medical history, airport medical care, and adherence to rostering protocols. ALPA has highlighted the urgent need for improved pilot rest regulations and mental health support within the aviation industry, emphasizing concerns about pilot welfare and working conditions.

title: Watch: Rohit opens up on having Wankhede stand named after him
content: In a moving tribute, the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) has decided to name a stand at Wankhede Stadium after Rohit Sharma, celebrating his leadership and contributions, including recent World Cup and Champions Trophy wins. Additionally, stands will be named after the late Ajit Wadekar, honoring his historic Test series victories, and Sharad Pawar, recognizing his role in transforming Wankhede.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Tesla investor Ross Gerber has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted to X AI and he no longer prioritizes Tesla. Gerber highlighted the negative impact of Musk's social media activity and political associations on Tesla's reputation. Despite a decline in Tesla's stock and sales, Gerber's firm continues to hold shares, anticipating a potential turnaround.

title: International space mission carrying Indian astronaut to fly in May: Centre
content: India marks a new milestone in space exploration as IAF Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is set to fly to the ISS in May 2025 as part of Axiom Mission 4. Selected for this NASA-approved private spaceflight, Shukla will be the second Indian in space after Rakesh Sharma.

title: With Draupadi warning, HC refuses action on man's plea against wife's lover
content: The Delhi High Court discharged a man in an adultery case, referencing the Mahabharat to highlight the patriarchal roots of the now-defunct adultery law. Justice Neena Bansal Krishna emphasized the Supreme Court's 2018 judgment decriminalizing adultery, stating that the law treated women as property. The court quashed the complaint, asserting that the outdated notion of marital ownership over women is unconstitutional.

title: Sundar Pichai reacts to Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis on Time cover
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis has been named in Time Magazine's 2025 TIME100 list for his groundbreaking AI research, particularly AlphaFold's protein structure predictions. Sundar Pichai congratulated Hassabis on X. Jennifer Doudna, a Nobel laureate, lauded Hassabis's interdisciplinary approach, noting his AI tools are accelerating discoveries in biology and medicine, helping tackle genetic diseases and climate challenges.

title: Markets rally over 6% in 4 days, investors gain Rs 25.77 lakh cr - Key points
content: Indian markets concluded the week with significant gains, fueled by returning foreign investment and easing inflation. The Sensex and Nifty surged over 6% in four sessions, boosting investor wealth substantially. A favorable monsoon forecast and the RBI's accommodative stance further contributed to the market's positive momentum.

title: In major bureaucratic reshuffle, Centre appoints Arvind Shrivastava revenue secretary
content: In a significant bureaucratic reshuffle, Arvind Shrivastava, a 1994 batch IAS officer, has been appointed as the new Revenue Secretary. Vumlunmang Vualnam will take over as Secretary, Department of Expenditure, succeeding Manoj Govil. Vivek Aggarwal has been named Secretary of the Ministry of Culture, marking key changes in central government departments.

title: Pakistan general's two-nation remark a bid to stir India unrest?
content: Pakistan's army chief, Gen Asim Munir, delivered a provocative speech urging Pakistanis to uphold the 'two-nation theory,' sparking concerns in India. Intelligence sources view this as a diversionary tactic amid internal security challenges and escalating conflicts with the TTP and Baloch insurgents.

title: 'Either Babar Azam has an ego issue or is too shy to ...'
content: Zaheer Abbas believes Babar Azam's form slump may stem from reluctance to seek advice from senior players, contrasting it with Younis Khan and Mohammad Azharuddin's past consultations. Inzamam-ul-Haq, drawing from his own experience, advised Babar to remain patient, strategically target bowlers, and persevere through this challenging phase to regain his form and improve match outcomes.

title: Florida shooter ‘espoused so much white supremacist rhetoric'
content: A gunman, identified as Phoenix Ikner, opened fire at Florida State University, killing two and injuring six. Ikner, the son of a sheriff's deputy, had a history of espousing white supremacist rhetoric, according to former classmates. The shooting prompted panic on campus, with students scrambling for safety as Ikner was eventually shot by responding officers and hospitalized.

title: 'Kaam ho gaya': Minor girl stabs husband, shows body to lover on video call
content: In a shocking incident in Burhanpur, a 25-year-old man was brutally murdered by his 17-year-old wife and her lover's accomplices. The minor wife, involved in an affair, orchestrated the murder with her boyfriend, even showing him the body via video call. Police have arrested the wife, her boyfriend, and two accomplices, including a juvenile, for the gruesome crime.

title: 'Woh past tha': Chahal's confession leaves Preity Zinta 'very happy'
content: Punjab Kings secured a thrilling 16-run victory over Kolkata Knight Riders, fueled by Yuzvendra Chahal's exceptional 4/28. Chahal's performance, which included dismissing key KKR batsmen, propelled him to become the 11th-highest wicket-taker in T20s. The win, celebrated by team co-owner Preity Zinta, moved Punjab Kings to fourth place in the standings.

title: Babu's blunder in court lands Munni Devi in jail instead of Munni Mansoori
content: In a bizarre turn of events in Bareilly's CB Ganj, Munni Devi, a 65-year-old woman, was wrongly jailed for electricity theft due to a warrant intended for another woman with a similar name. Her son, Rakesh, fought for her release, proving her innocence. Sub-Inspector Saurabh Yadav acknowledged the error, leading to Munni Devi's release after three days.

title: IPL: Why Karun said sorry to DC co-owner Parth Jindal?
content: Delhi Capitals' Karun Nair apologized to co-owner Parth Jindal after their loss to Mumbai Indians, despite Nair's impressive 89 off 40 balls. Jindal had praised Nair's batting, especially against Jasprit Bumrah, acknowledging the unpredictable nature of sports after both Delhi Capitals and Bengaluru FC faced defeats. Delhi Capitals, currently leading the points table, will next face Gujarat Titans.

title: Abhishek Nayar back to KKR? Chakravarthy’s Insta story goes viral
content: Speculation is rife about Abhishek Nayar's potential return to Kolkata Knight Riders after Varun Chakravarthy's cryptic Instagram post. Following his departure from the BCCI, fans are linking Nayar, a former KKR coach, back to the franchise where he mentored key players and contributed to their success. A reunion could reignite KKR's title aspirations.

title: 'No one opposed to caste census in cabinet': Siddaramaiah clarifies
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said that the cabinet discussion on the Socio-Economic and Educational Survey, also known as the caste census, was inconclusive and postponed to May 2. Despite concerns raised by ministers regarding the survey's unscientific nature and outdated information, Siddaramaiah denied reports of heated arguments, emphasising that no one opposed the survey outright.

title: ‘Going to move on’: US gives ultimatum on Russia, Ukraine peace deal
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that the US may withdraw from brokering a Russia-Ukraine peace deal within days if progress isn't evident. Following meetings in Paris, Rubio emphasised the urgency for a breakthrough, citing stalled negotiations due to Russia's demands and disagreements between Presidents Trump and Zelenskyy. Despite a potential minerals agreement, the US

title: Bengal guv reaches Malda to meet riot victims, ignores Mamata's request
content: West Bengal governor C V Ananda Bose reached Malda to meet victims of the Murshidabad communal violence, defying chief minister Mamata Banerjee's request to postpone the trip. He aims to assess the situation firsthand, visiting hospitals, residences, and relief camps to formulate recommendations. The governor plans to meet victims who fled there following recent communal violence in Murshidabad district.

title: 'Cricketers sent me nude photos': Sanjay Bangar's child makes shocking revelation
content: Ananya Bangar, just like their father, represented India in 12 Tests and 15 ODIs between 2001 and 2004. Anaya  played for Islam Gymkhana in local club cricket and has also represented Hinckley Cricket Club in Leicestershire. However, in November 2023, the International Cricket Council (ICC) announced a new policy barring transgender athletes from participating in women's international cricket.

title: What is Article 142? Why VP Jagdeep Dhankhar called it a 'nuclear missile'
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has voiced strong concerns about the judiciary's increasing reliance on Article 142 of the Constitution, describing it as a threat to democratic forces. He called for a review of constitutional interpretation practices, particularly in light of recent judicial directives to the President regarding state bills.

title: ED set to turn up heat on Vadra, readies chargesheets in 3 cases
content: The Enforcement Directorate is likely to file prosecution complaints against Robert Vadra in multiple money laundering cases, including the Gurgaon land deal. These cases also involve alleged links to arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari and the Bikaner land deal. Vadra's questioning follows charges against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, intensifying scrutiny on financial dealings.

title: 'TN will never yield to Delhi's administration': Stalin's 'challenge' for Amit Shah
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has strongly criticized the central government, asserting that the state will not submit to New Delhi's authority. He challenged Amit Shah's ambition to form a government in Tamil Nadu in 2026, emphasising that tactics like party poaching and raids will not succeed there. Stalin said "Tamil Nadu will never yield to Delhi's administration".

title: 'Haven’t taken anybody’s name': Baba Ramdev defends 'sharbat jihad'
content: Baba Ramdev defended his "sharbat jihad" remark, claiming he didn't target any specific brand, while Congress leader Digvijaya Singh filed a police complaint alleging promotion of religious hatred. Singh accused Ramdev of indirectly targeting Rooh Afza, implying its sales fund religious institutions, and demanded an FIR for inciting communal sentiments. Police are investigating Singh's complaint.

title: No nationwide rollout of satellite tolling from May 1: Government
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) has refuted claims of a nationwide satellite-based tolling system replacing FASTag by May 1, 2025. Instead, MoRTH will introduce an ANPR-FASTag-based barrier-less tolling system at select locations to ease traffic flow. This hybrid system will use number plate recognition and FASTag, with penalties for non-compliance.

title: IPL match today: RCB vs PBKS - all you need to know
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru faces Punjab Kings tonight, aiming to break their home losing streak in IPL 2025. Despite winning all away matches, RCB struggles at Chinnaswamy Stadium due to sluggish pitches and dew. Their pace attack, particularly Josh Hazlewood, has underperformed at home.

title: PM Modi dials Elon Musk, says 'committed to advancing partnerships'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Elon Musk discussed enhancing technology and innovation collaboration between India and the US, building on their previous meeting. Tesla and Starlink's potential entry into the Indian market was a key topic, with Tesla exploring manufacturing and Starlink partnering with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel. “

title: 'Reinstated' USAC directors reject truce as turmoil deepens ahead of USOPC deadline
content: USAC announced the termination of Whitaker, Nijjar and Gona in February this year after their ethics committee corroborated the charges of ‘wreaking havoc on other board directors, including by disrupting meetings, ignoring their obligations, breaching confidentiality, publicising false allegations about the board and putting their interests above the organizations’ leveled against the trio.

title: 'Protect own minorities': India slams Bangladesh's remark on Bengal violence
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has firmly dismissed Bangladesh's remarks regarding the Murshidabad violence, urging them to address the persecution of their own minorities. The MEA refuted Bangladesh's denial of involvement and accusations against India, following unrest that claimed lives and displaced families.

title: Athiya-Rahul reveal their baby girl's name with adorable first pic- See inside
content: Athiya Shetty and KL Rahul have revealed the name of their newborn daughter, Evaarah, with an adorable photo shared on social media. The couple welcomed their baby girl on March 24th, and the name, Evaarah, is described as a 'Gift of God'. Celebrities like Arjun Kapoor, Malaika Arora, and Anushka Sharma showered the couple with love.

title: Watch: Bengaluru man’s tea-time stunt on busy road for viral reel ends in arrest
content: In Bengaluru, a 25-year-old named Prashanth was arrested for creating a disruptive social media reel on a busy road. The police took action after his video, showing him drinking tea in the middle of traffic, went viral. He faces charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita for causing public nuisance and was later released on station bail.

title: 'Will be animals in next birth': MP BJP MLA warns voters 'influenced' by gifts
content: BJP MLA Usha Thakur sparked controversy by asserting that voters who accept money or gifts will be reincarnated as animals. She highlighted the BJP government's financial aid programs, expressing dismay that votes are still traded for small sums. Thakur urged citizens to protect democracy and support the BJP, which she believes serves national interests.

title: Protest erupts in Delhi's Seelampur after 17-year-old boy stabbed to death
content: A 17-year-old boy from New Seelampur, Northeast Delhi, was fatally stabbed on Thursday evening. Police responded to a PCR call at 7:38 pm and rushed him to the hospital, but he died during treatment. Following the incident, protests erupted, and a case has been registered as police investigate and search for the culprit.

title: Flying to US? Customs officers can search your phone, laptop...
content: US Customs and Border Protection officers are increasingly searching electronic devices of incoming passengers, including citizens. CBP can conduct basic searches without suspicion, but advanced searches require reasonable suspicion and managerial approval. Individuals should document interactions with CBP, understand their rights regarding password disclosure, and obtain receipts for detained devices.

title: Himachal chief secretary throws Holi party for bureaucrats, sends bill to govt
content: Himachal Pradesh's chief secretary, Prabodh Saxena, faces scrutiny after allegedly billing the government for a Holi party he hosted for IAS officers and their families. The Rs 1.22 lakh bill, submitted to the general administration department, has sparked controversy. This incident follows previous allegations against another former chief secretary, Shrikant Baldi, for misusing funds, prompting calls for investigation and accountability.

title: 'Caught stealing red-handed yet again': BJP targets Congress over National Herald case
content: Anurag Thakur criticized the Congress party following the ED's chargesheet in the National Herald case, alleging repeated corruption. He stated the party's unease indicates guilt, referencing historical scams. The ED's chargesheet against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi involves alleged proceeds of crime, while Congress dismisses the case as politically motivated, leading to protests.

title: Bhagavad Gita, Natyashastra added to Unesco’s Memory of the World Register
content: The Shrimad Bhagavad Gita and Bharat Muni’s Natyashastra have been inscribed in Unesco’s Memory of the World Register, marking a significant recognition of India’s civilisational legacy. Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat hailed this as a historic moment, emphasizing their role as philosophical and aesthetic foundations.

title: Man Who Sexually Assaulted Air Hostess In Gurugram Hospital ICU Arrested
content: It took four days. A scan of 800 CCTV cameras. A Special Investigation Team (SIT) aided by 8 crack teams to arrest a man who had allegedly raped a woman in an Intensive Care Unit of a hospital in Gurugram.

title: Indian Astronaut-Designate Shubhanshu Shukla To Fly To Space Station in May
content: Announcing a timeline for what will be a huge step in India's space journey, the Centre has said Gaganyatri, or astronaut-designate, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will fly to the International Space Station next month.

title: Amit Shah Urges Hiding Naxals To Surrender,  Join Mainstream
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday asked all underground Maoists to surrender as soon as possible and join the mainstream, saying the government is determined to free the country from the scourge of Maoism before March 31, 2026.

title: Adani Realty Crowned Visionary Real Estate Brand At Grohe Hurun India Conclave 2025
content: Adani Realty, the real estate arm of the diversified Adani Group, has been honoured with the prestigious Grohe Hurun India Visionary Real Estate Brand of the Year Award at the Real Estate Leaders' Conclave 2025, held here in the national capital.

title: On Camera, Speeding SUV Hits Man Crossing Road In UP,  He Survives
content: The victim was severely injured in the incident. He was rushed to the Lalitpur Medical Hospital, where he is undergoing treatment.

title: Ukraine Receives Over 900 Bodies Of Soldiers From Russia Killed During War
content: The exchange of prisoners and war dead is one of the few areas of cooperation between the two sides since Russia invaded Ukraine more than three years ago.

title: Indian Students In US Make Up 50% Of Recent Visa Revocations: Report
content: The AILA brief, titled 'The Scope of Immigration Enforcement Actions Against International Students', highlights that 50 per cent of these students were from India, followed by 14 per cent from China.

title: No Satellite-Based Tolling System From May 1, FASTags To Continue: Centre
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways said some sections of the media have reported that a satellite-based Tolling System will be launched from 1st May 2025.

title: Who Is Ziqra? Social Media-Savvy 'Lady Don' Linked To Delhi Teen's Murder
content: Ziqra is frequently seen roaming around Seelampur with a pistol and had also waved the gun around during Holi celebrations. Videos of her with the gun led to a case against her under the Arms Act.

title: BJP, Allies Have Edge In Assam Panchayat Polls, Congress Alleges Misuse Of Power, Funds
content: Ahead of the 2026 Assam election, all eyes are on the panchayat polls scheduled on May 2 and May 7. The ruling BJP-led alliance has already taken a big lead, winning 37 zila parishad and 288 anchalik panchayat seats unopposed.

title: Spring Snowstorm In The Alps Kills 3, Causes Huge Destruction
content: Although snow in April is not rare in the Alps mountain range, the amount that fell in just hours was unusual and took authorities and residents by surprise.

title: "Out-And-Out Murder": Supreme Court On UP 'Dishonour Killing'
content: Irked over framing of the milder charge of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, the Supreme Court ordered framing of murder charges against members of a family in a case of dishonour killing in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Chhattisgarh Man Kills Mother After She Denies Him Rs 200 To Purchase Puppy
content: A man allegedly bludgeoned his 70-year-old mother to death after she refused to give him Rs 200 to purchase a dog in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Friday, police said.

title: Key Government Departments Get New Heads In Bureaucratic Reshuffle
content: Senior bureaucrat Arvind Shrivastava has been appointed as the new Revenue Secretary as part of a top-level bureaucratic reshuffle effected by the Centre on Friday.

title: "Only Path To Peace In Manipur...": Kuki BJP MLA, Wounded In May 2023, Returns Home
content: BJP MLA and former Manipur minister Vungzagin Valte told NDTV the only path to peace in Manipur is autonomy for the Kuki, Zomi, and Hmar people with a Union Territory status.

title: Failed Relationships Increasingly Resulting In Criminal Cases: High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has expressed concern over an emerging trend of failed intimate relationships increasingly resulting in criminal proceedings.

title: "Revenge Porn?" Nude Photos Of Dead Japanese Singer On CD Sparks Row
content: The governor of Kumamoto region in southern Japan, where the singer Aki Yashiro was from, slammed the decision as an "unforgiveable" act in a blog post published Wednesday.

title: Rs 1,000 Per Plate, Rs 1.2-Lakh Bill: Bureaucrat's Lavish Party Sparks Row
content: Lunch at Rs 1,000 per plate for IAS officers and their families, for drivers at nearly Rs 600, taxi fare and a total bill of over Rs 1.2 lakh - a Holi party thrown by the Himachal Pradesh Chief Secretary has sparked a row.

title: Russian President Putin's 30-Day Order Not Hit Ukraine Energy Targets "Expired": Kremlin
content: Russia announced the truce on March 18 following a call between Putin and US President Donald Trump, but both Moscow and Kyiv accused each other of repeatedly breaking it.

title: PFL best bets: How Impa Kasanganay can bounce back
content: Impa Kasanganay, who won the 2023 light heavyweight season, takes on Fabian Edwards in one of four middleweight bouts . the card at Universal Studios also features four lightweight bouts, including Gadzhi Rabadanov taking on Marc Diakiese .

title: 2025 college baseball ace rankings: The best starting pitchers
content: the aim here is to rank college starting pitchers based on who I would want to start a game in Omaha with the highest stakes, against the best lineups . this isn't a prospect list -- I lean more on current ability rather than in the future .

title: Spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content:
Pete Thamel tells Pat McAfee that Nico Iamaleava is unlikely find a situation where he gets his asking price through the portal. (1:17) College football 's spring transfer portal period opened Wednesday and runs through April 25. More than  2,700 players  have elected to transfer this offseason. This period is the last chance for underclassmen to switch teams before the start of the 2025 season and for schools to bolster their roster. The biggest news of the spring period happened this past weekend when  Tennessee   parted ways  with quarterback  Nico Iamaleava . The former four-star recruit, who threw 19 touchdown passes in 2024, was seeking an increase in his  NIL package . He is now looking for a new home, and  UCLA is in the hunt . With players officially able to enter their names in the portal, we tracked all the latest news and developments. Here's a look at how Day 1 unfolded.  Transfer portal coverage: 
 Best available player rankings

title: Why Stanford softball is playing its 2025 season in the football stadium
content: a new, $50 million softball stadium will be built in 2023 . allister was on cloud nine after the announcement that she was planning to build the stadium . she felt fortunate that the university was showing this commitment to her program . the stadium's construction is rare, and she felt lucky that it was a success .

title: Top five news of the day: Sibal defends SC from VP's attack & more
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: What's behind this stifling, confusing LeBron-led Lakers defense
content: the lakers had defeated the Knicks 128-112 behind a stout defensive effort . a box score offered clues at how they'd done it . the next game, 122-97 win over the Clippers, offered more evidence .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers, Mets or Padres No. 1 this week?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers have fallen from the top spot thanks to a recent rough patch . the New york Mets, San Diego Padres or San Francisco Giants replaced the defending champions atop our week 3 Power Rankings .

title: 'Yeet!': The unexpected and highly unlikely rise of WWE's Jey Uso
content: JEY USO is not supposed to be in the world heavyweight title match vs. Gunther . he never dreamed of standing tall by himself at WrestleMania as a champion . jey and Jimmy Uso have accomplished everything a tag team could want in WWE .

title: Texas coach Steve Sarkisian: Arch Manning has 'grandpa's gene'
content: arch Manning is set to start for the Longhorns at quarterback in 2025 . he'll be the longhorns' full-time starting quarterback this fall . the program is facing big expectations after reaching the semifinals of the college football Playoff .

title: NBA playoffs bracket
content: Content extraction failed.

title: In another first after Rana extradition, US arrests alleged Khalistani terrorist in California
content: Rajghatta is author of Kamala Harris: Phenomenal Woman 10 Popular types of chilies from around the world Baby names inspired by female leaders and great personalities of India Best clicks of Esha Kansara ​10 animals whose names begin with the letter R 8 most notable books with strong female leads and characters 10 animals that can survive in extreme conditions 10 electronics that consume the most energy in people's homes Zodiac signs who love with all their heart All about the Caracal: A fierce and vicious member of the wild cat family

title: TCS hit with bias allegations in US layoffs; co rejects them as ‘misleading’
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Move to establish theme park at Mukkombu welcomed
content: The theme park is to be stablished under the public private participation mode and a preliminary study has already been conducted to know the feasibility

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla set for space travel in May
content: A decorated test pilot with the Indian Air Force, Group Captain Shukla was shortlisted under ISRO's Human Spaceflight Program and is among the top contenders for the Gaganyaan mission

title: New textbooks named thoughtfully to convey rootedness in India’s culture, says NCERT
content: The response from National Council of Education Research and Training comes after a controversy erupted over NCERT using Hindi titles for English language textbooks

title: Karaikal anganwadi workers seek reimbursement for fuel and vegetable expenses
content: Employees’ federation says several workers had not received their salaries for months and they were forced to use personal funds to prepare meals for children

title: Probe into pregnant leopard’s death in A.P.: tension as villagers object to ‘unjust detention of innocents’
content: Despite alerting the Forest Department quite early, the rescue team arrived late, and the prolonged lapse of time led to the animal’s death due to exhaustion and thirst, the villagers insist; they appeal to Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan to ensure an unbiased inquiry into the issue

title: Tiruchi city police to step up surveillance near Chathiram bus stand with more cameras
content: About 12 surveillance cameras are to be installed additionally at vantage points to cover the Karur bypass which is abuzz all through the day as a crime prevention measure

title: Trinamool MP Yusuf Pathan lands in controversy over his silence on Murshidabad violence
content: “Here Hindu Muslims have grown up together. Someone from outside can cause such incidents, but it doesn’t mean Murshidabad has become a communal district,” said former Congress State president Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury

title: Order probe into Kancha Gachibowli land to prove environmental commitment: KTR to Modi
content: BRS leader alleges that State Government has also mortgaged a water body with the 400 acre land parcel to raise ₹10,000 cr.

title: Karnataka set to become the first to complete village-level survey of antiquities
content: There are more than 25,000 monuments in the State as per an estimate, and given the challenges in their conservation, programmes like Adopt a Monument has been floated s

title: Chief Minister to buy more time to arrive at consensus on caste census
content: Knowing well the importance of the support of both the dominant communities as well as the OBC bloc in the electoral arena, Siddaramaiah is expected to take time and tread carefully

title: One worker dead, two critical during blasting at coal mine in Chhattisgarh
content: The incident took place around noon in the Gare Palma coal mine of Jindal Power Limited in Dongamahua village of Tamnar area, a police official said.

title: Assam child sexual abuse survivor thanks cop with sketch
content: The 16-year-old girl, who cleared her Class 10 exams, said she found strength and inspiration in Pratibha Bora, a sub-inspector at the Satgaon police station

title: Congress to go solo in Gujarat bypolls, no alliance with AAP: Gohil
content: Gujarat Congress president Shaktisinh Gohil said the party has decided to stay away from the AAP for the by-elections because the Kejriwal-led party already declared its candidate for Visavadar seat without consultion

title: Government committed to make India self-reliant in defence sector: Rajnath Singh
content: The defence production is at ₹1.60 lakh crore at present and the aim is to increase it to ₹3 lakh crore

title: Watermelon price crashes in Tiruchi markets
content: Glut of the fruit and fears triggered by reports of widespread adulteration across the State have pushed down the price of the juicy fruit which is sought-after in summer

title: Deepthi, a native of Guntur in Andhra Pradesh, dies in U.S. road accident
content: Pursuing her MS in the University of North Texas, Deepthi sustained multiple injuries when she was hit by a car while walking on the road a couple of days ago, and succumbed while undergoing treatment in a hospital

title: Andhra Pradesh government’s support sought for the protection of folk arts
content: Major temples in the State should adopt one folk art so that artistes will get livelihood and youngsters get an opportunity to learn the art, says Kalapeetham founder-president

title: Janakrosh Yatra: State BJP slams Karnataka government over guarantee schemes, industrial policy
content: Vijayendra attributed the region’s lag in industrial development to what he termed the government’s “anti-industry” policies

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: What are the provisions in Telangana’s draft bill for gig workers?
content: The draft bill mentions the rights of the workers; their income security; work conditions; transparency in respect of automated monitoring  and decision making systems and others.

title: Arvind Shrivastava appointed Revenue Secretary in Centre's major bureaucratic reshuffle
content: Vivek Aggarwal, a 1994 batch IAS officer of Madhya Pradesh cadre, has been appointed as Secretary, Ministry of Culture.

title: Never seen any RS chairperson make such political comments: Sibal on Dhankhar's judiciary remarks
content: Mr. Dhankhar on April 17 questioned the judiciary setting a timeline for the President to take decisions and act as a ‘super Parliament’, saying the Supreme Court cannot fire a ‘nuclear missile’ at democratic forces

title: Traffic police rescue children stuck in car at Tirumala
content: The guardians locked two children in the vehicle and went out to find the way to the Tirumala temple

title: Pay property tax by April 30 to avail of 5% rebate, Vizianagaram Municipal Corporation urges people
content: 50% interest waiver will also be given to those paying property tax arrears by April 30, says the Municipal Commissioner

title: Job working powerloom units in Coimbatore and Tiruppur await call for talks with the government on wage issue
content: The powerloom unit owners are on indefinite strike since March 19 and on indefinite fast since April 15

title: INSV Tarini with all-women crew heads home after crossing Cape of Good Hope
content: As part of the ongoing Navika Sagar Parikrama II, the vessel, crewed by Lt Cdr Dilna K and Lt Cdr Roopa A, made a scheduled stopover at Cape Town recently

title: Pune bus depot rape case: Police file 893-page charge sheet, include statements of 82 witnesses
content: The 893-page chargesheet filed in the court of the judicial magistrate first class (JMFC) contains the statements of 82 witnesses, the official added.

title: Eight-year-old boy dies of Kyasanur Forest Disease in Manipal
content: The boy and his elder sister had developed high fever about 12 days ago and were being treated at a private hospital in Manipal.

title: Don’t share views on AIADMK-BJP alliance on social media: Nainar Nagenthran to party cadre
content: The BJP leader’s remarks came a day after the AIADMK urged its office-bearers not to express views to the media on the position and activities of the organisation without taking prior approval from the party leadership

title: CM invites Japanese businesses to become part of TelanganaRising
content: Come to Telangana, find China +1 alternative. Invest, thrive, grow and succeed. Hyderabad will feel like home, the Chief Minister told Japan Inc.

title: CET 2025 exam: Based on preliminary report on removal of ‘janivara’, Shivamogga DC recommends action against a home guard
content: Representatives of Brahmin Sanghagala Okkuta had complained that Brahmin students appearing for CET at Adichunchanagiri College centre were forced to remove the ‘sacred thread’ before entering the exam hall.

title: Hyderabad’s Tarnaka junction reopened on trial basis, sees low traffic flow on Good Friday
content: Depending on the level of congestion observed during the trial (till May 2), there is a possibility that the junction may be closed again, an officer said.

title: Ramachandrapuram police thwart medical student’s attempt to end his life
content: Superintendent of Police V. Harshavardhan Raju commended the team for responding swiftly and saving the medical student’s life

title: Rahul Gandhi urges Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah to enact Rohith Vemula Act for ending caste-based discrimination
content: In his letter to Siddaramaiah, Rahul Gandhi highlighted the discrimination B.R. Ambedkar faced in his lifetime.

title: Former Navy Captain Jagmohan appointed Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Chairman and Managing Director
content: Former Navy Captain Jagmohan appointed as CMD of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited, extensive experience in shipbuilding

title: The urgent need to bridge gaps to make dialysis more accessible and affordable for patients
content: Diabetes, hypertension and Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown origin are the main causes for the rise in the number of persons requiring dialysis. While some States are well equipped with haemodialysis machines, major gaps exist in others, while access and affordability remain challenges across the country

title: 2D Echo technician impersonated a doctor, MBBS doctor functioned as  clinical cardiologist at health centre in Telangana’s Suryapet
content: IMA complained that several private hospitals operated using medical registration certificates of doctors without their knowledge or consent

title: Government bonds in India: understanding the financial market component
content: Government bonds are a fundamental component of a country’s financial market, serving as a crucial instrument for both the government and investors

title: Supreme Court dismayed over MP HC refusing bail
content: A bench of Justices Abhay S Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan granted bail to a man and said a convict should be granted bail if there was no chance of appeal against conviction being heard in near future in high courts due to huge pendency of cases.

title: Swachha Andhra Diwas on April 19 with theme ‘e-Check’
content: The theme is ‘e-Check’ aimed at collecting and reusing electronic waste from homes and shops in both towns and rural areas

title: BJP’s formula of breaking parties to form government won’t work in Tamil Nadu: Stalin tells Amit Shah
content: Reiterating that the DMK’s Dravidian model of governance would emerge victorious in 2026, Mr. Stalin asserted: “Our Tamil Nadu will always remain out of control for Delhi.”

title: Agriculture Department brings out Krishi Varthe newsletter to provide information to stakeholders
content: The Kannada newsletter would include useful information on farm ponds, mechanisation of farming, various government schemes and details on diagnoses of diseases and pests affecting the farming sector through e-SAP, a mobile app.

title: No decision yet on Nationwide rollout of satellite-based tolling from May 1: MoRTH
content: Automatic Number Plate Recognition intended to replace FASTag-based toll collection system was to be launched on May 1st according to some sections of the media, Ministry says will be implemented at selected toll plazas

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko faces police summons as drug misconduct row rages on
content: Kerala Police to examine actor Vincy Aloshious’ complaint to film bodies that Shine Tom Chacko misbehaved with her allegedly under the influence of drugs on a film set

title: Andhra Pradesh Government relaxes age limit for DSC applications as one-time measure
content: The government, in its Order, iterated that it is a one-time measure and a special case for the Mega District Selection Committee recruitment subject to conditions

title: The Congress journey in Gujarat
content: From ruling the State for three decades to being out of power for the same duration, the Congress has experienced much tumult in Gujarat. It is now revamping its organisation to face the Gujarat battle in 2027.

title: How well do you know Kerala’s native mangoes?
content: Mango collectives in Kerala are diligently working towards conserving, propagating and creating awareness about unique indigenous varieties

title: Kerala film chamber panel to take up Vincy Aloshious’ complaint against Shine Tom Chacko
content: Saji Nanthiyattu, general secretary of KFCC, says emergency meeting of 29-member monitoring committee will be held on April 21 to discuss the complaint

title: Doyen of Indian angioplasty Mathew Samuel Kalarickal no more
content: Dr. Kalarickal performed the first angioplasty in India in 1986, and was also instrumental in setting up and establishing angioplasty facilities in a number of countries in the Asia-Pacific Region

title: Janivara and Shivadara row: Karnataka Higher Education Minister says strict action will be taken if allegations are true
content: A student in Bidar and another in Shivamogga, who were writing their CET, were forced by the exam centre officials to remove their ‘Shivadara’ and ‘Janivara’ (consecrated threads worn by members of certain communities), respectively.

title: Rape accused thrashed; tied to bullock cart; paraded naked in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich
content: "A separate case has been registered regarding the assault and investigations are under way in both the rape case and the mob violence matter," ASP Kushwaha said

title: People of all faiths rejecting communal politics of BJP, says CWC member Gidugu Rudra Raju
content: ‘People understood that only Congress Party would protect secularism,’ says CWC member Gidigu Rudra Raju

title: Manuscripts of Bhagavad Gita, Natyashastra inscribed on UNESCO's Memory of the World Register
content: As of April 17, 2025, 74 new documentary heritage collections were added to UNESCO’s Memory of the World Register

title: PM Modi speaks to Elon Musk, discusses ‘potential collaboration in technology’
content: Prime Minister Modi discusses collaboration with Elon Musk on technology and innovation, following their meeting in Washington D.C.

title: A total of 22 Maoists surrender before security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
content: “The surrendered Maoists were active in the Maad (Chhattisgarh) and Nuapada (Odisha) divisions of Maoists,” Sukma Superintendent of Police Kiran Chavan said

title: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar slams opposition to Hindi in schools, says Marathi will still remain top priority
